item.title: My Janky Home Server
item.description: Yes, this piece of junk is my home server :V I don’t know exactly what this board is called, it was taken from all-in-one PC from an old ticketing machine a few years ago. Even though it isn’t that powerful, it has served me well for years. Hardware CPU: Intel Celeron J1800 (2) @ 2.58 GHz RAM: 4GB DDR3L 1333Mhz Storage: 32GB mSATA Software I tried a couple of different operating systems, but Alpine Linux is the most suitable for my use and this machine.

item.title: Arch Linux Install (Hyprland)
item.description: (WIP) Installation My arch linux installation. Archinstall [minimal]: Compositor : Hyprland Terminal : Wezterm Bar/Dock : Ags (https://github.com/Aylur/ags) File-manager : Nautilus My dotfiles availabe on (github) **SOON yay Notes: Run as user NOT ROOT! git clone https://aur.archlinux.org/yay cd yay makepkg -si Packages yay -S hyprland aylurs-gtk-shell polkit-gnome neovim viewnior \ pavucontrol sassc swww wl-clipboard wf-recorder brightnessctl \ hyprpicker slurp grimblast wayshot swappy nautilus nerdfonts Configuration Wrapping the launcher #!/bin/sh export LIBVA_DRIVER_NAME=nvidia export XDG_SESSION_TYPE=wayland export GBM_BACKEND=nvidia-drm export __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia export WLR_NO_HARDWARE_CURSORS=1 exec Hyprland bash_profile if [[ -z $DISPLAY && $(tty) == /dev/tty1 && $XDG_SESSION_TYPE == tty ]]; then exec /home/r4sso/.
